Calculate Summary Statistics for Consumer Data

Source: R/summary_stats.R
calculate_summary_stats.Rd

This function calculates descriptive statistics for a numeric variable. It is designed to be transparent and easy to understand for reviewers. All calculations are performed using base R functions with clear, step-by-step operations.

Usage

calculate_summary_stats(data, include_all = TRUE, round_digits = 2)

Arguments

data

A numeric vector containing the data to summarize. Missing values (NA) are automatically removed before calculations.

include_all

Logical. If TRUE, includes additional statistics like variance and range. Default is TRUE.

round_digits

Integer. Number of decimal places for rounding results. Default is 2.

Value

An analysis_result object containing descriptive statistics, including sample size, location/dispersion measures, and optional extended metrics.

Examples

# Example 1: Basic usage with sample consumer spending data
spending <- c(45.2, 67.8, 23.4, 89.1, 34.5, 56.7, 78.9, 12.3)
calculate_summary_stats(spending)
#> ============================================================================== 
#> Descriptive Statistics RESULTS
#> ============================================================================== 
#> 
#> SUMMARY
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
#> • Sample size: N = 8 
#> • Alpha level: 0.05 
#> Error in if (x$significant) "Significant" else "Not significant": missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed

# Example 2: Data with missing values (automatically handled)
satisfaction <- c(7, 8, NA, 6, 9, 7, NA, 8, 7)
calculate_summary_stats(satisfaction)
#> ============================================================================== 
#> Descriptive Statistics RESULTS
#> ============================================================================== 
#> 
#> SUMMARY
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
#> • Sample size: N = 7 
#> • Alpha level: 0.05 
#> Error in if (x$significant) "Significant" else "Not significant": missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed

# Example 3: With fewer statistics and more decimal places
prices <- c(19.99, 24.99, 29.99, 34.99, 39.99)
calculate_summary_stats(prices, include_all = FALSE, round_digits = 3)
#> ============================================================================== 
#> Descriptive Statistics RESULTS
#> ============================================================================== 
#> 
#> SUMMARY
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
#> • Sample size: N = 5 
#> • Alpha level: 0.05 
#> Error in if (x$significant) "Significant" else "Not significant": missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed
